title: It. Is. So. Ridiculously. Hot.
body: I'm sorry I haven't posted lately, but this heat has melted my brain into a warm puddle of memories and long-forgotten Nintendo cheat codes. I know we're not alone - isn't half the country griped by a heat wave right now? - but still... IT'S DAMN HOT! I have an extension for Firefox that shows me the weather in my status bar, and for the last week and a half it's been flashing this icon that sort of resembles a red, flaming penis: I think it's supposed to be a thermometer, but COME ON! That's some bad icon design, if you ask me... and I know you DIDN'T! Both of our showings of the MSU Student Showcase sold out on Tuesday and Wednesday. I wasn't expecting last night's show to sell out, but was pleasantly surprised when it did. The air conditioner, however, wasn't as excited. You see, our building is entirely exposed on the West side (look), which means the bricks get baked by the sun for 8+ hours every day, and then at night they slowly release the heat back into our auditorium. That's usually not a problem when we have smaller crowds, but once you cram in 75 hot people, it starts to get really hot and really humid really fast. Our air conditioner just can't keep up! So, for those of you who battled through the Southern Louisiana atmosphere of our auditorium last night, thank you! I hope you enjoyed the films. August's line-up is done, which means it's time for me to start bangin' away at the calendar. Here's a quick look at what's coming up: + August 2 - 8: HEART OF THE GAME + August 4 - 5: RAISING ARIZONA (late-night showings) + August 9 - 22: STRANGERS WITH CANDY / AN INCONVENIENT TRUTH + August 22 - 23: ONLY HUMAN + August 23 - Sept 5 - HOMEMADE HILLBILLY JAM + August 23 - 29 - WASSUP ROCKERS + August 30 - TBD - WORDPLAY It's a very simple, and stellar, line-up... just the way we like it. I'm waiting to hear back from Big Smith (the stars of HOMEMADE HILLBILLY JAM) on when they'll be available for a Q&A or two. I'm sure those shows will sell out pretty quick. Oh man, I suddenly got hit with a tremendous hunger pain... I'm outta here. NOTE: Don't forget, the PEARL WHITE SILENT FILM SUMMER SERIES has been moved from this Saturday to the next (July 29th). Still the same place, the old firehouse, and same time, dusk (9-ish). Hopefully we'll see you there. ONE MORE THING: Remember our old neighbor back in St. Louis (long-time readers might)? Yeah, well, she's going to be spending the next 11 years in federal prison. She stole our mail, my camera, and Nicole's iPod (for a week), so I'm glad she's finally getting what she deserves.
author: Dan

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
That lady sounds like a monster! 
It's monsterly hot outside!
You've got a monster of a lineup in August!
How many times could I possibly use the word monster (4)?

comments.author: Steve Richards
comments.body: I think the oppressive temperatures play into your hand with An Inconvenient Truth.  The hotter the temperature the more relevant the movie will seem.  Probably won't contribute to Wassup Rockers though.

comments.author: Matthew Martin aka Master RJ
comments.body: Wassup Rockers will probably be so steaming hot, the temperatures will increase themselves.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
It's too darn hot here too, and we haven't even heard of air-conditioning. (Well, that's not quite true, but neither my flat or my office has it. I'm sitting in an ice-cold computer room right now though! Woot!)

I covered the outside of my bedroom windows in tin foil the other day, and it's definitely helped. You guys will just need a bit more foil...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I will say this: those giant blocks that I built to cover up the windows... they're completely cool to the touch on the auditorium side. Four inches of soundboard and foam insulate really do make a difference!

comments.body: I actually thought of lining the stairwell on the side of the building with tin foil, but it would probably blind drivers passing by.
